org.gearvrf.scene_objects.view

Class GVRFrameLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.FrameLayout
          • org.gearvrf.scene_objects.view.GVRFrameLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, GVRView

    public class GVRFrameLayout
extends android.widget.FrameLayout
implements GVRView
    This class represents a FrameLayout that is rendered into the attached GVRViewSceneObject. Every Android view added to this layout will be rendered into attached GVRViewSceneObject. See GVRView and GVRViewSceneObject

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
      To draw the GVRView into its GVRViewSceneObject is necessary override GVRView.draw(Canvas) and call the superclass version replacing the given Canvas by other one provided by GVRViewSceneObject.lockCanvas().
      android.view.View getView()
      GVRViewSceneObject will call it to get the view.
      void setSceneObject(GVRViewSceneObject sceneObject)
      The scene object created to this view will call GVRView.setSceneObject(GVRViewSceneObject) to set itself to the view.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Description copied from interface: GVRView
        To draw the GVRView into its GVRViewSceneObject is necessary override GVRView.draw(Canvas) and call the superclass version replacing the given Canvas by other one provided by GVRViewSceneObject.lockCanvas(). After drawing into the GVRViewSceneObject's Canvas, the caller must invoke GVRViewSceneObject.unlockCanvasAndPost(android.graphics.Canvas) to post the new contents to the scene object. See GVRViewSceneObject.lockCanvas() and GVRViewSceneObject.unlockCanvasAndPost(Canvas)
        Specified by:
        draw in interface GVRView
        Overrides:
        draw in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        canvas - Use it to get some dimensions to be applied to the new Canvas given by GVRViewSceneObject#lockCanvas(android.graphics.Rect)

      • setSceneObject

        public void setSceneObject(GVRViewSceneObject sceneObject)
        Description copied from interface: GVRView
        The scene object created to this view will call GVRView.setSceneObject(GVRViewSceneObject) to set itself to the view.
        Specified by:
        setSceneObject in interface GVRView
        Parameters:
        sceneObject - GVRViewSceneObject created to this view.

      • getView

        public android.view.View getView()
        Description copied from interface: GVRView
        GVRViewSceneObject will call it to get the view.
        Specified by:
        getView in interface GVRView
        Returns:
        Returns GVRView instance as Android view.
